message.content:
I need to identify the line item that represents the systematic allocation of the depreciable amount of an asset over its useful life, which is typically called "Depreciation" in a cash flow statement.

Looking at the cash flow statement provided, I can see a line item called "Depreciation" with a value of 45749.47 on 2024-01-29. This is exactly what I'm looking for - it represents the systematic allocation of the depreciable amount of assets over their useful lives.

This is a common non-cash expense that appears in the operating section of the cash flow statement, as it's added back to net profit when calculating net cash from operations.

```json
{"solution": {'value': '45749.47'} }
```
